query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
1 Di nova pena mi conven far versi 2 e dar matera al ventesimo canto 3 de la prima canzon, ch’è d’i sommersi.
query.error: **English:** 1 Of new pain I must make verses 2 and give material to the twentieth canto 3 of the first song, which is of those submerged.
query.result: 1 Navasya duḥkhasya kṛte pad्यानि kartavyāni mayā 2 evaṃ viṃśatitamaḥ sargaḥ sampādayitavyaḥ 3 ādyasya gītasya, yaḥ magnajanānāṃ viṣaye vartate.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
4 Io era già disposto tutto quanto 5 a riguardar ne lo scoperto fondo, 6 che si bagnava d’angoscioso pianto;
query.error: **English:** 4 I was already completely ready 5 to look into the depths of the abyss, 6 which was bathed in sorrowful tears;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
7 e vidi gente per lo vallon tondo 8 venir, tacendo e lagrimando, al passo 9 che fanno le letane in questo mondo.
query.error: **English:** 7 and I saw people coming 8 silently and weeping, in a slow procession, 9 like the litanies in this world.
query.result: 7 Paśyāmi ca janān āgacchatas tasyām anukramaṇikāyām, 8 Mūkaḥ aśru-dhārā-yuktaḥ, tām gatiṃ gacchan, 9 Yām gacchanti loke letanyāḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
10 Come ’l viso mi scese in lor più basso, 11 mirabilmente apparve esser travolto 12 ciascun tra ’l mento e ’l principio del casso,
query.error: **English:** 10 As my gaze descended lower, 11 I saw, wondrous to behold, 12 each one twisted between the chin and the beginning of the chest,
query.result: 10 Yathā mama dṛṣṭiḥ adhastāt avajagāma, 11 Aścaryeṇa prakāreṇa adṛśyata parivṛttaḥ 12 Ekaikaḥ kaṇṭhasya mūlasya ca madhye,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
13 ché da le reni era tornato ’l volto, 14 e in dietro venir li convenia, 15 perché ’l veder dinanzi era lor tolto.
query.error: **English:** 13 for their faces were turned backward, 14 and they were forced to walk backward, 15 because their sight was taken from them in front.
query.result: 13 Yataḥ pratyañcam vikṛtaḥ āsīt vaktraḥ, 14 Pratyak pravṛttaḥ ca āgacchaty eva, 15 Yataḥ pūrvataḥ paśyantaḥ te nirastāḥ āsīt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
16 Forse per forza già di parlasia 17 si travolse così alcun del tutto; 18 ma io nol vidi, né credo che sia.
query.error: **English:** 16 Perhaps by force of paralysis 17 someone was completely overthrown; 18 but I did not see it, nor do I believe it happened.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
19 Se Dio ti lasci, lettor, prender frutto 20 di tua lezione, or pensa per te stesso 21 com’ io potea tener lo viso asciutto,
query.error: **English:** 19 If God allows you, reader, to take fruit 20 from your reading, then consider for yourself 21 how I could keep my face dry,
query.result: 19 Yadi devatā tvām, vācaka, śrāvayati phalam 20 tava pāṭhasya, tadā svayam eva cintaya 21 katham aham śuṣkam mukham dhārayitum śaknomi,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
22 quando la nostra imagine di presso 23 vidi sì torta, che ’l pianto de li occhi 24 le natiche bagnava per lo fesso.
query.error: **English:** 22 when I saw our image so twisted nearby, 23 that the tears from my eyes 24 wet my buttocks through the crack.
query.result: 22 yadā aśru-binduḥ akṣiṇoḥ samīpe 23 tathā vikṛtaḥ adṛśyata, yena nadi-dvayam 24 nābher madhye śayyāṃ samvardhayati sma.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
25 Certo io piangea, poggiato a un de’ rocchi 26 del duro scoglio, sì che la mia scorta 27 mi disse: «Ancor se’ tu de li altri sciocchi?
query.error: **English:** 25 Certainly I wept, leaning against one of the rocks 26 of the hard cliff, so that my guide 27 said to me: "Are you still one of the other fools?
query.result: 25 Nityaṃ aham arodam āśritya ekaṃ śilākhaṇḍam 26 kathinasya prastarasya, yataḥ mama netā 27 uvāca: "Api tvam adyāpi asmād anye mūḍhāḥ asi?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
28 Qui vive la pietà quand’ è ben morta; 29 chi è più scellerato che colui 30 che al giudicio divin passion comporta?
query.error: **English:** 28 Here pity lives when it is quite dead; 29 who is more wicked than he 30 who endures suffering in the divine judgment?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
31 Drizza la testa, drizza, e vedi a cui 32 s’aperse a li occhi d’i Teban la terra; 33 per ch’ei gridavan tutti: “Dove rui,
query.error: **English:** 31 Raise your head, raise it, and see to whom 32 the earth opened itself to the eyes of the Thebans; 33 because of which they all cried out: "Where are you rushing,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
34 Anfïarao? perché lasci la guerra?”. 35 E non restò di ruinare a valle 36 fino a Minòs che ciascheduno afferra.
query.error: **English:** 34 Amphiaraus? Why do you leave the war?". 35 And he did not stop his fall until he reached the valley, 36 where Minos seizes each one of them.
query.result: 34 Amphiarāo? Kimartham yuddham jahāsi?". 35 Na ca niṣpatitaḥ abhūt adhastāt 36 Yāvat Mīnoḥ yaḥ ekaikaṃ gṛhṇāti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
37 Mira c’ha fatto petto de le spalle; 38 perché volle veder troppo davante, 39 di retro guarda e fa retroso calle.
query.error: **English:** 37 Look how he has made a chest of his shoulders; 38 because he wanted to see too far ahead, 39 he looks behind and goes backward.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
40 Vedi Tiresia, che mutò sembiante 41 quando di maschio femmina divenne, 42 cangiandosi le membra tutte quante;
query.error: **English:** 40 Behold Tiresias, who changed his form 41 when from male he became female, 42 all his members being changed;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
43 e prima, poi, ribatter li convenne 44 li duo serpenti avvolti, con la verga, 45 che rïavesse le maschili penne.
query.error: **English:** 43 and first, then, it was necessary for him to strike 44 the two entwined serpents with the rod, 45 so that he might regain his male parts.
query.result: 43 tataś ca, paścāt, tasmai punar āhataṃ kartavyam āsīt 44 ubhau sarpau parivṛtau daṇḍena, 45 yathā sa punaḥ puṃstvaṃ prāpnuya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
49 ebbe tra ’ bianchi marmi la spelonca 50 per sua dimora; onde a guardar le stelle 51 e ’l mar non li era la veduta tronca.
query.error: **English:** 49 He had the cave among the white marbles 50 for his dwelling; whence to watch the stars 51 and the sea his view was not cut off.
query.result: 49 Tasya śvetānāṁ mārmaṇānāṁ madhye guhā āsīt 50 Niśīthāya; yataḥ tārān 51 Samudram ca paśyataḥ tasya dṛṣṭiḥ na chinna āsīt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
58 Poscia che ’l padre suo di vita uscìo 59 e venne serva la città di Baco, 60 questa gran tempo per lo mondo gio.
query.error: **English:** 58 After his father departed from life 59 and the city of Bacchus became a servant, 60 this [city] rejoiced greatly throughout the world.
query.result: 58 Tataḥ paścāt pitur jīvitāt niṣkramaṇāt 59 Bacoḥ purī ca daivī dāsī abhavat, 60 sā cirakālam jagati prītim prāptavān.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
61 Suso in Italia bella giace un laco, 62 a piè de l’Alpe che serra Lamagna 63 sovra Tiralli, c’ha nome Benaco.
query.error: **English:** 61 Up in beautiful Italy lies a lake, 62 at the foot of the Alps that enclose Germany, 63 above the Tyrol, whose name is Benaco.
query.result: 61 Ūrdhvam sundareyām Itāliyāyām vartate ekaḥ hradaḥ, 62 Alpaśikharasya adhastāt yaḥ samāvarayati Jarmanīyaṃ, 63 Tiralli-upari, yasya nāma asti Benaco.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
64 Per mille fonti, credo, e più si bagna 65 tra Garda e Val Camonica e Pennino 66 de l’acqua che nel detto laco stagna.
query.error: **English:** 64 Through a thousand springs, I believe, and more 65 between Garda and Val Camonica and Pennino 66 of the water that stagnates in the said lake.
query.result: 64 Sahasra-dhārāḥ, manye, adhikāśca sechante 65 Gardasya Val Camonicāyāśca Penninasya ca madhye 66 jale tasmin sthite.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
67 Loco è nel mezzo là dove ’l trentino 68 pastore e quel di Brescia e ’l veronese 69 segnar poria, s’e’ fesse quel cammino.
query.error: **English:** 67 The place is in the middle where the Trentine 68 shepherd and the Brescian and the Veronese 69 could all point, if they were to make that journey.
query.result: 67 Sthānaṃ madhye asti tatra yatra Trentinaḥ 68 paśupālaḥ, Bṛ̥śyāḥ, Vairocanīyaśca 69 darśayitum śaknuvanti, yadi te margam tam kurvanti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
70 Siede Peschiera, bello e forte arnese 71 da fronteggiar Bresciani e Bergamaschi, 72 ove la riva ’ntorno più discese.
query.error: **English:** 70 Peschiera sits, a beautiful and strong fortress, 71 to confront the Brescians and Bergamasques, 72 where the shore around descends more.
query.result: 70 Upaviśati Peśīvaraḥ, sundaraḥ ca balavān ca sastrasaṃgrahaḥ, 71 Bresciyāṇānāṃ ca Bergamāścānāṃ pratirodhanāya, 72 yatra tīraṃ paritaḥ adhikaṃ niṣaṇṇam asti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
73 Ivi convien che tutto quanto caschi 74 ciò che ’n grembo a Benaco star non può, 75 e fassi fiume giù per verdi paschi.
query.error: **English:** 73 There it is necessary that everything fall 74 that cannot stay in Benaco's lap, 75 and it forms a river down through the green pastures.
query.result: 73 Tatrāvaśyam sarvam patati 74 yat Benaco-kukshau sthātum na śaknoti, 75 nadiś ca bhavati adhaḥ harita-kṣetreṣu.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
76 Tosto che l’acqua a correr mette co, 77 non più Benaco, ma Mencio si chiama 78 fino a Governol, dove cade in Po.
query.error: **English:** 76 As soon as the water begins to flow, 77 it is no longer called Benaco, but Mincio, 78 until Governolo, where it falls into the Po.
query.result: 76 Yada eva jalam pravāhaṃ karoti, 77 na punaḥ Benaco, api tu Mencio abhidhīyate, 78 Yāvat Governolum, yatra Po-yam patati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
79 Non molto ha corso, ch’el trova una lama, 80 ne la qual si distende e la ’mpaluda; 81 e suol di state talor essere grama.
query.error: **English:** 79 He had not traveled far when he found a marsh, 80 in which he sank and became mired; 81 and in summer it is often dry.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
82 Quindi passando la vergine cruda 83 vide terra, nel mezzo del pantano, 84 sanza coltura e d’abitanti nuda.
query.error: **English:** 82 Then, passing by the raw virgin, 83 she saw land, in the middle of the marsh, 84 uncultivated and naked of inhabitants.
query.result: 82 Tatra tatīḿ krūra-kanyāḿ atītya 83 Dṛṣṭavān asmi madhye paṅkagasyedaḿ bhūmim 84 Anūrūdhāḿ nirjanāḿ ca.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
85 Lì, per fuggire ogne consorzio umano, 86 ristette con suoi servi a far sue arti, 87 e visse, e vi lasciò suo corpo vano.
query.error: **English:** 85 There, in order to flee all human company, 86 he remained with his servants to practice his arts, 87 and he lived there and left his mortal body there.
query.result: 85 Tatrāsarvakulaparihāraṇāya 86 Svasakhibhiḥ saha svasya kalāḥ kartum sthitaḥ, 87 Jīvitvā tatraiva śarīram tyaktavān.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
88 Li uomini poi che ’ntorno erano sparti 89 s’accolsero a quel loco, ch’era forte 90 per lo pantan ch’avea da tutte parti.
query.error: **English:** 88 Then the men who were scattered around 89 gathered at that place, which was strong 90 because of the marsh that surrounded it on all sides.
query.result: 88 Naraśca ye paritaḥ vikṣiptāḥ āsīt 89 Te samāgacchan tatra sthāne, yat balavat āsīt 90 Sarvataḥ palvalena yasmāt āvṛtam āsīt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
91 Fer la città sovra quell’ ossa morte; 92 e per colei che ’l loco prima elesse, 93 Mantüa l’appellar sanz’ altra sorte.
query.error: **English:** 91 He made the city over those dead bones; 92 and for her who first chose the place, 93 he called it Mantua without further thought.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
94 Già fuor le genti sue dentro più spesse, 95 prima che la mattia da Casalodi 96 da Pinamonte inganno ricevesse.
query.error: **English:** 94 Already his people were thicker outside, 95 before the madness of Casalodi 96 received deceit from Pinamonte.
query.result: 94 Tasyāḥ prajāḥ bahiḥ adhika gaṇanāḥ āsīt, 95 Pūrvam yāvat Kaśalodīyaḥ unmādaḥ 96 Pināmonteḥ vyājena gṛhītaḥ āsīt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
97 Però t’assenno che, se tu mai odi 98 originar la mia terra altrimenti, 99 la verità nulla menzogna frodi».
query.error: **English:** 97 But I assure you that if you ever hear 98 my homeland spoken of differently, 99 the truth is no lie or deceit.
query.result: 97 Tathāpi tvām pratijānāmi yadyadi kadācit 98 śrṇoṣi mama janmabhūmim anyathā, 99 satyam eva na mithyā vāñchanā vā.

100 E io: «Maestro, i tuoi ragionamenti 101 mi son sì certi e prendon sì mia fede, 102 che li altri mi sarien carboni spenti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
103 Ma dimmi, de la gente che procede, 104 se tu ne vedi alcun degno di nota; 105 ché solo a ciò la mia mente rifiede».
query.error: **English:** 103 But tell me, of the people who are proceeding, 104 if you see any worthy of note; 105 for to that alone my mind turns.

106 Allor mi disse: «Quel che da la gota 107 porge la barba in su le spalle brune, 108 fu—quando Grecia fu di maschi vòta,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
109 sì ch’a pena rimaser per le cune— 110 augure, e diede ’l punto con Calcanta 111 in Aulide a tagliar la prima fune.
query.error: **English:** 109 so that hardly any remained for the cradles— 110 an augur, and gave the signal with Calchas 111 in Aulis to cut the first rope.
query.result: 109 yathā kaumārabhṛtya eva avasiṣṭāḥ āsīt— 110 ṛtvik āsīt, tataś ca Kalkantena saha Aulidyām 111 prathamam rajjum chettum saṃjñām adāt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
112 Euripilo ebbe nome, e così ’l canta 113 l’alta mia tragedìa in alcun loco: 114 ben lo sai tu che la sai tutta quanta.
query.error: **English:** 112 His name was Euryphilus, and thus 113 my lofty tragedy sings in some place: 114 you know it well, for you know it all.
query.result: 112 Asya nāma Euryphilos āsīt, evam ca 113 mayā viracitā uttamā nāṭakī katham api sthāne gāyati: 114 tvam api jānāsi, yataḥ tvam tām sarvām jānāsi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
115 Quell’ altro che ne’ fianchi è così poco, 116 Michele Scotto fu, che veramente 117 de le magiche frode seppe ’l gioco.
query.error: **English:** 115 That other one who is so lean in the flanks, 116 was Michael Scot, who truly 117 knew the game of magical deceptions.
query.result: 115 Saḥ aparo yaḥ kaṭi-deśe evaṃ kṛśaḥ asti, 116 Saḥ Michael Scot āsīt, yaḥ satyam eva 117 Jādu-kapatānāṃ krīḍāṃ ajānāt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
118 Vedi Guido Bonatti; vedi Asdente, 119 ch’avere inteso al cuoio e a lo spago 120 ora vorrebbe, ma tardi si pente.
query.error: **English:** 118 See Guido Bonatti; see Asdente, 119 who now would like to have divined with leather and cord, 120 but he repents too late.
query.result: 118 Paśya Guidoṃ Bonattiṃ; paśya Asdentem, 119 Yaḥ carmaṇā rajjvā ca jñātum icchati, 120 Adhunā ca paścāttāpaṃ karoti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
121 Vedi le triste che lasciaron l’ago, 122 la spuola e ’l fuso, e fecersi ’ndivine; 123 fecer malie con erbe e con imago.
query.error: **English:** 121 See the sad women who abandoned the needle, 122 the spool, and the spindle, and made themselves goddesses; 123 they made spells with herbs and with images.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
124 Ma vienne omai, ché già tiene ’l confine 125 d’amendue li emisperi e tocca l’onda 126 sotto Sobilia Caino e le spine;
query.error: **English:** 124 But come now, for it already holds the boundary 125 of both hemispheres and touches the waves 126 beneath Seville, where Cain and the thorns are;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
127 e già iernotte fu la luna tonda: 128 ben ten de’ ricordar, ché non ti nocque 129 alcuna volta per la selva fonda».
query.error: **English:** 127 and already last night the moon was full: 128 you must remember it well, for it did not harm you 129 at any time through the deep forest.
query.result: 127 Atha ca hyasya rātryāḥ pūrvaṃ pūrṇimā āsīt candrasya: 128 Tvam api smaryatevai tat, yataḥ na te apakurvata kaṣṭam 129 kadācid api kānanasyāntarāle gambhīre.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
130 Sì mi parlava, e andavamo introcque.
query.error: **English:** 130 Thus he spoke to me, and we went on together.
query.result: 130 Evam mama sa uvāca, atha sahaivāgamāvahi.
